issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
We have a queue with persistent tasks and one single STOMP1.1 consumer from a PHP daemon. 
Consumer has prefetch=1 and historical selector "convert_string_expressions:JMSXDeliveryCount<10" that was used before we moved to STOMP1.1 with NACK support.
Now we use NACK support and have enabled DLQ handling and redelivery for all queues:

{code}
        <destinationPolicy>
            <policyMap>
              <policyEntries>
                <policyEntry queue=">" prioritizedMessages="true" maxPageSize="100" useCache="true" expireMessagesPeriod="0" queuePrefetch="1" gcInactiveDestinations="true" inactiveTimoutBeforeGC="86400000">
                    <deadLetterStrategy>
                        <individualDeadLetterStrategy queuePrefix="DLQ." topicPrefix="DLQ." useQueueForTopicMessages="true" useQueueForQueueMessages="true" processNonPersistent="true"/>
                    </deadLetterStrategy>
                </policyEntry>
                <policyEntry topic=">">
                    <deadLetterStrategy>
                        <individualDeadLetterStrategy queuePrefix="DLQ." topicPrefix="DLQ." useQueueForQueueMessages="true" useQueueForTopicMessages="true" processNonPersistent="true"/>
                    </deadLetterStrategy>
                </policyEntry>
              </policyEntries>
            </policyMap>
        </destinationPolicy>

        <plugins>
            <redeliveryPlugin fallbackToDeadLetter="true" sendToDlqIfMaxRetriesExceeded="true">
                <redeliveryPolicyMap>
                    <redeliveryPolicyMap>
                        <defaultEntry>
                            <redeliveryPolicy maximumRedeliveries="6" initialRedeliveryDelay="10000" useExponentialBackOff="true" backOffMultiplier="3" />
                        </defaultEntry>
                    </redeliveryPolicyMap>
                </redeliveryPolicyMap>
            </redeliveryPlugin>
        </plugins>
{code}

With that configuration I'm expecting to see messages in the DLQ after max 6 redeliveries and max 2430000 msecs. But sometimes this rule is violated and I can see messages in the DLQ with redeliveryDelay=90000, 270000. What is more strange, that there is messages in the DLQ with redeliveryDelay=9000, which is not multiply of configured 10000. 

Subscription mode for consumer is default (not specified). Logic of consumer is pretty simple: take one message, process it and then say "ack" or "nack" in the case of exceptions or fatal errors during handling. 

So, the questions is: why does the broker can move messages to the DLQ too early without respecting the configured number of redeliveries and timeout between redelivery?
fields.summary: Message is moved to DLQ too early after several redeliveres
